item

Class Item

  • java.lang.Object
    • item.Item
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IItem, TronObject
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Flag, ForceFieldGenerator, IdentityDisk, LightGrenade, Teleporter

    public abstract class Item
extends java.lang.Object
implements IItem
    an abstract implementation of the item interface. This class offers some basic functionality for most Items (e.g. ID).
    Author:
    Bavo Mees

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Item()
      Constructs a new Item and gives it a unique ID.

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      AffectedByPowerFailure asAffectedByPowerFailure()
      By default an item is not affected by a power failure, therefore this method returns null.

      By default an item is not explodable, therefore this method returns null.

      By default an item is not teleportable, therefore this method returns null.
      Effect getEffect()
      Returns the effect this item has on an object.
      int getId()
      Returns the unique ID of this item
      UseArguments<?> getUseArguments()
      By default an item does not require addition parameters from the user

      • asTeleportable

        public Teleportable asTeleportable()
        By default an item is not teleportable, therefore this method returns null. Subclasses implementing the teleportable interface should override this method with the specification described here.
        Specified by:

        Returns:

      • asAffectedByPowerFailure

        public AffectedByPowerFailure asAffectedByPowerFailure()
        By default an item is not affected by a power failure, therefore this method returns null. Subclasses implementing the AffectedByPowerFailure interface should override this method with the specifications described here.
        Specified by:
        asAffectedByPowerFailure in interface TronObject
        Returns:
        an AffectedByPowerFailure

      • getEffect

        public Effect getEffect()
        Returns the effect this item has on an object. By default this will be an EmptyEffect. Items with custom effects need to override this method.
        Returns:
        the effect of the item
